posts.title: Hello World
posts.text: Welcome to Hexo! This is your very first post. Check documentation for more info. If you get any problems when using Hexo, you can find the answer in troubleshooting or you can ask me on GitHub. Quick StartCreate a new post1$ hexo new "My New Post" More info: Writing Run server1$ hexo server More info: Server Generate static files1$ hexo generate More info: Generating Deploy to remote sites1$ hexo deploy More info: Deployment _config.yml1theme: icarus bash1find / -name '*abc*' 1234567package mainimport "fmt"func main() { fmt.Println("hello world")}

More information can be found on the â€œZsh Web Pagesâ€ sites.Zshæ˜¯ä¸€ç§ä¸ºäº¤äº’ä½¿ç”¨è€Œè®¾è®¡çš„shellï¼Œå°½ç®¡å®ƒä¹Ÿæ˜¯ä¸€ç§å¼ºå¤§çš„è„šæœ¬è¯­è¨€ã€‚æ›´å¤šä¿¡æ¯å¯åœ¨â€œZshç½‘é¡µâ€ç½‘ç«™ä¸Šæ‰¾åˆ°ã€‚ Zsh Web Pagesæ˜¯è¿™ä¹ˆä»‹ç»çš„ Zsh is a shell designed for interactive use, although it is also a powerful scripting language. Many of the useful features of bash, ksh, and tcsh were incorporated into Zsh; many original features were added. The introductory document details some of the unique features of Zsh. It assumes basic knowledge of the standard UNIX shells; the intent is to show a reader already familiar with one of the other major shells what makes Zsh more useful or more powerful. This document is not at all comprehensive; read the manual entry for a description of the shell that is complete, concise and up-to-date, although somewhat overwhelming and devoid of examples. Alternatively, the user guide offers wordy explanations of many of the shellâ€™s features.
